graphicslib3D.editors

Class BezierPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.Point3D
      • graphicslib3D.editors.BezierPoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BezierPoint
extends Point3D
    This class is a helper class supporting the SurfacePatchDialog; it is not intended to be used directly. It extends the Point3D class by providing a second set of coordinates to select a point and draw selected and unselected points. The contains() method determines whether a mouse click occurred inside a point, and the point's isSelected and size attributes can be set. The class can also hold an old version of a point (for Undo operations) and matrix transformations to the point are applied here. Note that there are two sets of coordinates; one set (the origin coordinates) is used to provide untransformed data to an outside class, and the other set (the parent Point3D coordinates) are transformed and used for draw() and contains() operations.
    Version:
    1.1 09/02/03, 1.2 02/22/07 put inside "graphicslib3D" package
    Author:
    Matt Gross.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BezierPoint()
      Base constructor; all coordinates are initialized to 0, and the point size is set to 8 pixels in length.
      BezierPoint(double newX, double newY, double newZ)
      First overloaded constructor; both origin and location coordinates are set to the same passed values.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.awt.Point p)
        Determines whether a set of 2D coordinates falls inside the object. If the passed point is inside, TRUE is returned.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the object. The point will be drawn in red if it is highlighted (isSelected=true). Otherwise, the point will be drawn in cyan.

      • MoveObject

        public void MoveObject(int dx,
                       int dy,
                       int XZorY,
                       Matrix3D VTM)
        Moves the object along either the XZ axes or just X, Y or Z axis. A value of 0 for the XZorY variable indicates movement along the XZ axes, and a value of 1 indicates movement along the X axis, a value of 2 indicates movement along the Y axis, and a value of 3 indicates movement along the Z axis. Movement will not occur unless object's isSelected property is true.

      • MoveObject

        public void MoveObject(int dx,
                       int dy)
        Overloaded method that allows a point's originX and originY coordinates to be changed without requiring a matrix.

      • resetPoint

        public void resetPoint(Matrix3D VTM)
        Resets the point to its original values before the point was moved by the mouse (an undo operation). The current VTM must be passed to the function.

      • resetPoint

        public void resetPoint()
        Overloaded method that resets the point to its original x and y values only (a 2D undo operation). This method does not require a matrix.

      • setLocationX

        public void setLocationX(double newX)
        Sets the transformed Point3D x coordinate
